Official Website: http://squidsoft.net
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Humanity has just emerged from the lowest point in its collective history, and
the closest it has been to extinction since the advent of agriculture. By the
year 2304, the Coalition of humans and their alien allies the Jinu has spread
across the stars, and thought themselves powerful. But the Outsiders, an alien
empire occupying vast reaches of Rimward space, proved them wrong. First contact
between the two allies was severed, and suddenly humanity was alone. Then the
Outsiders attacked in force, and human planets and governments fell one by one.
                         It was the apocalypse.
But contrary to the beliefs of many, not all hope was lost. After five years,
a single starship, the Percival Lowell, returned from Rimward space, bringing
with it the means to nullify the Outsiders' greatest weapon. With this, and the
help of many other brave pilots, the occupying Outsiders were driven off human
               worlds and back to where they came from.
 Humanity is now trying to rebuild, and trying to regain what it has lost. The
Outsiders are finished with occupation, and now desire only to see humans
extinct.
New threats and new mysteries seem to appear every day. In the midst of it all,
civilian starships span the stars, maintaining an open threat against any new
       invasion and trying to make a few credits while they're at it.
You too have felt the lure of this; the desire for a unique freedom that most
citizens will never know, the drive to explore, the need to defend your species,
         and yes, greed for the vast wealth that is to be had.
                   It is time to take to the stars.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Welcome to the original and still the most innovative pulp science fiction
multiplayer roleplaying adventure!
Originally opened in its classic form on 19 December 1998! Reopened in its new
iteration on 28 February 2009!
All original work (including setting, non-player characters, design, source
code, all related background material, and all text) located in this game or on
the Squidsoft.net website is copyright (c) Squidsoft.net 1998-2015. Unauthorised
reproduction prohibited.
Warning: Speech in this game is largely uncensored, and sensitive individuals
may find some other players offensive. The staff is ultimately not responsible
for the words and actions of the players.

We're on Twitter! @StarConquest for server status notifications and out-of-game
contact!

    * Welcome to Star Conquest! *
[Starship "Firestorm"; Control Room]
The control room is the hub of every starship. Large metal conduits protect
thick bundles of wires carrying information from every part of the ship to this
one location. A large transparisteel viewport provides a view out the front of
the ship, but experienced pilots in space will have eyes only for the large
starmap dominating the right side of the room. Standing before the viewport is
the main control board, providing essential functions like the shipwide power
lever and alert status. Secondary control boards can be pulled up and folded
back to provide a working surface, or pulled down from recesses overhead as
needed. Though the room is spacious enough for a few others to sit or stand, the
entire architecture of the room is built around the small space before the
control board and the person who will stand there: the starship's pilot. The
status lights overhead are currently not receiving power. Looking through the
windows, you see that the ship is at New Earth; Spaceport Landing Pad.
You see a black leather captain's chair, a decoy beacon launcher, a
bioaugmentation plant in a small pot labeled "Space Invaders", and a wormhole
drive tracer here.
You can go south, up, and out.

alliance.

                          C  L  A  S  S  I  C
Official Website: http://www.squidsoft.net
-----------------------------------------------------------------------
Star Conquest is a multiplayer role-playing game set in interstellar
space, as well as on dozens of planets, space stations, and starships.
Your goal is what you want it to be.  There are many different ways to
make a living.  And you won't be alone; all your activities take place
with your choice of three diverse unions as a backdrop.  And when you
finally work your way up to one of the greatest powers in interstellar
space, a fourth alliance of certain humans and some alien species may
begin trying to recruit you.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------
Open to the public since 19 December 1998!
All original work located in this game is copyright (c) SquidSoft.net 1998-2009,
unauthorised reproduction prohibited.
Warning: Speech in this game is largely uncensored, and sensitive individuals
may find some other players offensive. The staff is ultimately not responsible
for the words and actions of the players.
NOTICE: Star Conquest: Classic is offered mainly for the purposes of nostalgia
and will receive MINIMAL support. Go to Star Conquest at telnet://squidsoft.net:
7777 for a more active development experience and to play the game as it is
meant to be!
The last server reset was at Tue Apr  4 22:33:21 2017 UTC
Contact us via email at: starconquest@squidsoft.net
Please log in now.
If you do not have a SquidSoft.net account and wish to create one, please send a
web browser here: http://moo.squidsoft.net:3333/

[Starship "Blueberry"; Living Quarters One]
Lights overhead indicate that the ship is on fuchsia status.  Looking through
the windows, you see that the ship is at New Earth; Spaceport Landing Pad.
You see a wooden wardrobe, a wicker rocking chair, a throw rug, a walnut canopy
bed with a lavender silk bedsheet, a floral pattern silk bedsheet, a lilac silk
blanket, and a lavender silk pillow on it, a large storage chest, a storage
container, a yellow storage locker, a pink mirrored vanity, a shaker chair, a
cedar dresser, a set of funky asymmetrical shelves, some black leather boots, a
plaid button down shirt, a pair of cotton briefs, and a pair of black corduroy
jeans here.
You can go out.
(You are lying on a walnut canopy bed.)

[New Earth; Spaceport Landing Pad]
The Spaceport of New Earth's capital city stands over a breathtaking crystal
clear bay which lies at the tip of the southern continent. The Landing Pad
itself is a huge, square sheet of plasteel, suspended by pillars over the water.
Ships surround you, and the bustle of daily business overwhelms your senses. To
the west you can see a bridge spanning the gap to the main building of the
Spaceport.
The one-person cargo hauler "Hauler3", the one-person cargo hauler "The
Harvina", the one-person supply shuttle "Unreality Programming 584", the
one-person supply shuttle "Unreality Programming 45", the one-person cargo
hauler "Debris Monster", the one-person cargo hauler "Sexy", the one-person
cargo hauler "Debris Makes Me, And Debris Breaks Me", the ten-person
battlecruiser "When The Ghostly Dust Of Violence Laces Everything", the
eight-person journeyer "Blueberry", the two-person corvette "Smasher", and the
three-person heavy cruiser "Crasher" are landed here.
You see an acclimated vegetation dispenser, Brooke the droid, a shiny blue
medical drone, a spherical security drone, a shiny blue medical drone, Jamie the
droid, a message drone, Liz the droid, Ernest the droid, Nef the droid, Lacey
the droid, Boe the droid, Hjelp the droid, a small trash can, Nick the droid,

[New Earth; Spaceport Landing Pad]
The Spaceport of New Earth's capital city stands over a breathtaking crystal
clear bay which lies at the tip of the southern continent. The Landing Pad
itself is a huge, square sheet of plasteel, suspended by pillars over the water.
Ships surround you, and the bustle of daily business overwhelms your senses. To
the west you can see a bridge spanning the gap to the main building of the
Spaceport.

sal

l
[Starship "Sandbagger"; Control Room]
Lights overhead indicate that the ship is on green status.  Looking through the
windows, you see that the ship is in space.
You see an FTL drive tracer, a sector debris scanner, a large beanbag chair, a
large leather lounge couch, and an internal stun turret here.
Lileah Rose (staring into space) (sitting on a large leather lounge couch) is
here.
You can go south and out.
(You are sitting on a large leather lounge couch.)
The debris is now secured in the ship's hold.  Scanning reveals it to be an
asteroid containing rock-eating microbes.

this ship.  You can request entry into its docking bay, or dock in the usual

Lights overhead indicate that the ship is on green status.  Looking through the
windows, you see that the ship is in space.

here.

Enter your destination:
A destination appears on the ship's navigation controls: Yuuijuminlakiltra.
dock
The Jinu starship "Yuuijuminlakiltra" has a docking bay large enough to contain
this ship.  You can request entry into its docking bay, or dock in the usual
manner by connecting to the docking ring near the control room.
y
Would you like to request entry into the docking bay?
[Enter `yes' or `no']
Request for entry into Yuuijuminlakiltra's docking bay sent.
Yuuijuminlakiltra accepts the entry request.
You feel a bit of acceleration as the ship begins docking procedures.

red.

l lileah
Lileah Rose
She seems to be a member of the AEU.
She appears to be in her mid-twenties.  She is about five feet and four inches
tall, has a thin build, and fair skin.  Her eyes are blue-green, and her
platinum blonde hair that goes to the middle of her back is straight.
She is uninjured.
For a top, she is wearing a blue chinasilk blouse over a satin bra.  For a
bottom, she is wearing a pair of flared faded denim jeans over a pair of skimpy
pink lace bikini cut panties.  She has on a pair of white leather sandals.  She
is also wearing a diamond choker, a small cloth sack, a Jinu translator, a
standard starship flightbag, a leather rifle sling, a metachannel FTL
communicator and watch, a metafrequency FTL transmitter, a personal filing
computer, a glittery camera with a flower strap, a large expandable telescoping
xenology container, a shimmering crystal bracelet, and a diamond tennis
bracelet.
She is carrying nothing.
The debris is now secured in the ship's hold.  Scanning reveals it to be an
abandoned storage pod.

Rolando Caganda  plays with the bottom hem of your blouse, "Sorry, I'll behave."

Lileah Rose
She seems to be a member of the AEU.
She appears to be in her mid-twenties.  She is about five feet and four inches
tall, has a thin build, and fair skin.  Her eyes are blue-green, and her
platinum blonde hair that goes to the middle of her back is straight.
She is uninjured.
For a top, she is wearing a satin bra.  For a bottom, she is wearing a pair of
flared faded denim jeans over a pair of skimpy pink lace bikini cut panties. 
She has on a pair of white leather sandals.  She is also wearing a diamond
choker, a small cloth sack, a Jinu translator, a standard starship flightbag, a
leather rifle sling, a metachannel FTL communicator and watch, a metafrequency
FTL transmitter, a personal filing computer, a glittery camera with a flower
strap, a large expandable telescoping xenology container, a shimmering crystal
bracelet, and a diamond tennis bracelet.

of rock and organic materials.

dock
The Jinu starship "Yuuijuminlakiltra" has a docking bay large enough to contain
this ship.  You can request entry into its docking bay, or dock in the usual
manner by connecting to the docking ring near the control room.
Would you like to request entry into the docking bay?
[Enter `yes' or `no']
y
Request for entry into Yuuijuminlakiltra's docking bay sent.
Yuuijuminlakiltra accepts the entry request.
You feel a bit of acceleration as the ship begins docking procedures.
You hear a solid thud as the ship sets down in a larger ship's docking bay.

 You are wearing a lightweight navy wool suit jacket, a long-sleeved white
cotton dress shirt, a pair of pleated front slim fit navy wool dress pants, and
a pair of black patent leather oxfords. Underneath this, you are wearing a pair
of white cotton briefs and a pair of black silk socks. You are also wearing a
keychain, a backpack, a metallic gold touch einrophone in a black leather phone
holster, a solid silver ring engraved with dolphins, and a gold wrist-mounted
chronometer. You are concealing a metallic silver metachannel FTL communicator,
a flight control scanner, a large expandable telescoping xenology container, a
scorched metal thigh holster, a golden Feng Wo coin purse, a camera bag, a black
engineering tool case, a black flightbag with a red shooting star on the side, a
leather briefcase, and a thick synthleather bandolier with large pockets. Your
head, face, both eyes, neck, both wrists, and both hands are left uncovered.
You are carrying nothing.

Official Website: http://squidsoft.net
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Humanity has just emerged from the lowest point in its collective history, and
the closest it has been to extinction since the advent of agriculture. By the
year 2304, the Coalition of humans and their alien allies the Jinu has spread
across the stars, and thought themselves powerful. But the Outsiders, an alien
empire occupying vast reaches of Rimward space, proved them wrong. First contact
between the two allies was severed, and suddenly humanity was alone. Then the
Outsiders attacked in force, and human planets and governments fell one by one.
                         It was the apocalypse.
But contrary to the beliefs of many, not all hope was lost. After five years,
a single starship, the Percival Lowell, returned from Rimward space, bringing
with it the means to nullify the Outsiders' greatest weapon. With this, and the
help of many other brave pilots, the occupying Outsiders were driven off human
               worlds and back to where they came from.
 Humanity is now trying to rebuild, and trying to regain what it has lost. The
Outsiders are finished with occupation, and now desire only to see humans
extinct.
New threats and new mysteries seem to appear every day. In the midst of it all,
civilian starships span the stars, maintaining an open threat against any new
       invasion and trying to make a few credits while they're at it.
You too have felt the lure of this; the desire for a unique freedom that most
citizens will never know, the drive to explore, the need to defend your species,
         and yes, greed for the vast wealth that is to be had.
                   It is time to take to the stars.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Welcome to the original and still the most innovative pulp science fiction
multiplayer roleplaying adventure!
Originally opened in its classic form on 19 December 1998! Reopened in its new
iteration on 28 February 2009!
All original work (including setting, non-player characters, design, source
code, all related background material, and all text) located in this game or on
the Squidsoft.net website is copyright (c) Squidsoft.net 1998-2015. Unauthorised
reproduction prohibited.
Warning: Speech in this game is largely uncensored, and sensitive individuals
may find some other players offensive. The staff is ultimately not responsible
for the words and actions of the players.
The last server reset was at Tue Jul 18 12:11:18 2017 UTC
We're on Twitter! @StarConquest for server status notifications and out-of-game
contact!

web address.

1
    * Welcome to Star Conquest! *
[Starship "Firestorm"; Control Room]
The control room is the hub of every starship. Large metal conduits protect
thick bundles of wires carrying information from every part of the ship to this
one location. A large transparisteel viewport provides a view out the front of
the ship, but experienced pilots in space will have eyes only for the large
starmap dominating the right side of the room. Standing before the viewport is
the main control board, providing essential functions like the shipwide power
lever and alert status. Secondary control boards can be pulled up and folded
back to provide a working surface, or pulled down from recesses overhead as
needed. Though the room is spacious enough for a few others to sit or stand, the
entire architecture of the room is built around the small space before the
control board and the person who will stand there: the starship's pilot. The
status lights overhead are currently not receiving power. Looking through the
windows, you see that the ship is at New Earth; Spaceport Landing Pad.
You see a black leather captain's chair, a decoy beacon launcher, a
bioaugmentation plant in a small pot labeled "Space Invaders", and a wormhole
drive tracer here.
You can go south, up, and out.

tra tac Anyone for beacons?

l
[Starship "Firestorm"; Control Room]
The control room is the hub of every starship. Large metal conduits protect
thick bundles of wires carrying information from every part of the ship to this
one location. A large transparisteel viewport provides a view out the front of
the ship, but experienced pilots in space will have eyes only for the large
starmap dominating the right side of the room. Standing before the viewport is
the main control board, providing essential functions like the shipwide power
lever and alert status. Secondary control boards can be pulled up and folded
back to provide a working surface, or pulled down from recesses overhead as
needed. Though the room is spacious enough for a few others to sit or stand, the
entire architecture of the room is built around the small space before the
control board and the person who will stand there: the starship's pilot. The
status lights overhead are currently not receiving power. Looking through the
windows, you see that the ship is at New Earth; Spaceport Landing Pad.
You see a black leather captain's chair, a decoy beacon launcher, a
bioaugmentation plant in a small pot labeled "Space Invaders", and a wormhole
drive tracer here.
You can go south, up, and out.
peer out
You peer out...
[New Earth; Spaceport Landing Pad]
The busy landing pad of New Earth's capital city's spaceport sits over a large
bay at the tip of the southern continent. The pad itself is a huge square sheet
of white plasteel surrounded by gleaming new starship service structures. On the
southern side of the pad is a circular structure with wide transparisteel
windows affording a fabulous view of the ocean. A softly lit sign over the
transparisteel doorway reads, 'Pilot Lounge,' and a separate doorway is marked
'Liaison Office.' It looks like you can GO into either of those places. To the
west, a bridge spans the gap between the landing pad and the rest of the
spaceport.
The three-person clipper "Firestorm" is landed here.
You see an automatic teller machine and a small trash can here.
You can go north, south, west, and down.
power
You grasp a large lever on the control board and push it slowly away from you.
Status lights blink on all around you as faint hums and beeps begin to emanate
from the various starship systems.
launch
You use the ship's radio to ask flight control for launch clearance.

of an interior panel from an exploding starship.

bonus of 2,625,000.00 AEU credits.

battle analysis scanner on a temporary space station.

green
You lift a small plastic cover and press a green button.
You hear a single beep and glance up to see green lights flick on overhead as
the ship enters normal status.
A low hum you had barely noticed until now slowly fades away as weapons are
powered down.

repair 11
Syntax:
  REPAIR <component>
  Such as: repair hull
  Or:      repair launcher 2
  Or:      repair stop
Valid components are: hull, sensors, FTL, launcher, turret, or STOP
repair laser 11

orders for light turret #11.

various changes to your liking.

help rescue pod
--
Star Conquest Help: Rescue Pods
--
Category: Game Systems
--
Space is dangerous. With this in mind, the now-defunct Intersector Shipbuilding
Company developed the rescue pod system. Rescue pods are partly memory metal,
partly inflatable, and can deploy near-instantly in the midst of a starship
losing structural integrity. Electromagnetic manipulators dedicated to the task
will place all crew members swiftly into the pod.
In other words, if your starship is destroyed, you will find yourself in a
rescue pod. Starships also additionally contain a single escape pod which can be
deployed manually. If you wish to manually escape your ship, simply use the
ESCAPE command. Note that this leaves your ship intact but empty; if you wish to
destroy your ship, check the Self-Destruct help file.
Rescue pods are fully automated for your own safety. Using sublight autopilot, a
built-in wormhole drive, and even a rift drive, your pod will transport you to
your home port in the most efficient manner. Using the DESTINATION command, you
can change your pod's destination to another alliance's port, as long as
diplomatic relations allow you to land there.
If you are on the other side of the skim gate from your home port, you will
probably very much want to use this DESTINATION command. Otherwise, your pod
will spend hours crossing the space that the skim gate covers.
--
destination
Your ship is loaded with nothing with any particular destination at the moment.
l
[Starship "Firestorm"; Control Room]
The control room is the hub of every starship. Large metal conduits protect
thick bundles of wires carrying information from every part of the ship to this
one location. A large transparisteel viewport provides a view out the front of
the ship, but experienced pilots in space will have eyes only for the large
starmap dominating the right side of the room. Standing before the viewport is
the main control board, providing essential functions like the shipwide power
lever and alert status. Secondary control boards can be pulled up and folded
back to provide a working surface, or pulled down from recesses overhead as
needed. Though the room is spacious enough for a few others to sit or stand, the
entire architecture of the room is built around the small space before the
control board and the person who will stand there: the starship's pilot. The
status lights overhead are currently not receiving power. Looking through the
windows, you see that the ship is in a garage.
You see a black leather captain's chair, a decoy beacon launcher, a
bioaugmentation plant in a small pot labeled "Space Invaders", and a wormhole
drive tracer here.
You can go south, up, and out.

l
[Starship "Firestorm"; Control Room]
The control room is the hub of every starship. Large metal conduits protect
thick bundles of wires carrying information from every part of the ship to this
one location. A large transparisteel viewport provides a view out the front of
the ship, but experienced pilots in space will have eyes only for the large
starmap dominating the right side of the room. Standing before the viewport is
the main control board, providing essential functions like the shipwide power
lever and alert status. Secondary control boards can be pulled up and folded
back to provide a working surface, or pulled down from recesses overhead as
needed. Though the room is spacious enough for a few others to sit or stand, the
entire architecture of the room is built around the small space before the
control board and the person who will stand there: the starship's pilot. The
status lights overhead are currently not receiving power. Looking through the
windows, you see that the ship is in a garage.
You see a black leather captain's chair, a decoy beacon launcher, a
bioaugmentation plant in a small pot labeled "Space Invaders", and a wormhole
drive tracer here.
You can go south, up, and out.
peer out

power
You grasp a large lever on the control board and push it slowly away from you.
Status lights blink on all around you as faint hums and beeps begin to emanate
from the various starship systems.
launch
You use the ship's radio to ask flight control for launch clearance.
A voice comes over the speaker and says, "Firestorm, you are given undock
clearance under the AEU-EAOS non-aggression pact."
ftl accord
A handful of lonely beacons watch over this area of space, their lights glowing
palely in the dark, surrounded by tendrils of drifting dust and debris.
A planet once existed here, until it was destroyed by the Outsiders. Now only
large chunks of the planet remain, still drifting slowly away from each other,
with clouds of debris filling the sector.
A circular space station dominates this sector, made of darkened metal
reinforced against attack. By the look of it, this is probably the most heavily
armored station in human space, excepting The Torus. This is the heart of the
Accord of Free Worlds.
The computer announces, "Autolander beacon detected. The ship will automatically
proceed to AFW Command (Dock One) in thirty seconds unless aborted or another
navigation order is entered."
Via general sector communication, Accord of Free Worlds Command transmits,
"Hello, Firestorm. Welcome to Accord space."

wait.

Worlds port."
power

leaving you in a dim silence.

[Accord of Free Worlds Command; Docking Bay Two]
The two-person tugboat "Gentle Push", the reconnaissance craft "Sg 10", the
two-person isotope "Wing Of Glory", the one-person runabout "Angel Wings", and
the three-person clipper "Firestorm" are landed here.
You can go southwest, northwest, and up.

[Accord of Free Worlds Command; Docking Bay Two]
The two-person tugboat "Gentle Push", the reconnaissance craft "Sg 10", the
two-person isotope "Wing Of Glory", the one-person runabout "Angel Wings", and
the three-person clipper "Firestorm" are landed here.

enter
[Starship "Firestorm"; Control Room]
You see a black leather captain's chair, a decoy beacon launcher, a
bioaugmentation plant in a small pot labeled "Space Invaders", and a wormhole
drive tracer here.
You can go south, up, and out.
power
You grasp a large lever on the control board and push it slowly away from you.
Status lights blink on all around you as faint hums and beeps begin to emanate
from the various starship systems.
launch
You use the ship's radio to ask flight control for launch clearance.
Flight control gives the ship launch clearance.

2
The perfect ring of The Torus spins serenely nearby.
The computer announces, "Autolander beacon detected. The ship will automatically
proceed to The Torus (Dock Alpha) in thirty seconds unless aborted or another
navigation order is entered."
Via general sector communication, The Torus transmits, "Greetings, Firestorm!
Welcome to The Torus!"

ships

[AEU | 10: Conquest Status] An AEU pilot corps liaison transmits, "Come on, we
can reach our performance goals if we try!"
The ship's computer automatically requests docking clearance.
A voice comes over the speaker and says, "We detect you to be an AEU ship,
Firestorm. The EAOS welcomes you under the non-aggression pact."
power

The faint sounds and status lights of the starship's systems slowly fade away,
leaving you in a dim silence.
The computer sounds a notification indicating that the ship has been fully
charged.

l
[Starship "Striking Distance"; Control Room]
The control room is the hub of every starship. Large metal conduits protect
thick bundles of wires carrying information from every part of the ship to this
one location. A large transparisteel viewport provides a view out the front of
the ship, but experienced pilots in space will have eyes only for the large
starmap dominating the right side of the room. Standing before the viewport is
the main control board, providing essential functions like the shipwide power
lever and alert status. Secondary control boards can be pulled up and folded
back to provide a working surface, or pulled down from recesses overhead as
needed. Though the room is spacious enough for a few others to sit or stand, the
entire architecture of the room is built around the small space before the
control board and the person who will stand there: the starship's pilot. The
status lights overhead are currently not receiving power. Looking through the
windows, you see that the ship is in a garage.
You see a black leather captain's chair, a wormhole drive tracer, and a decoy
beacon launcher here.
You can go up and out.
power
You grasp a large lever on the control board and push it slowly away from you.
Status lights blink on all around you as faint hums and beeps begin to emanate
from the various starship systems.

[The Torus; Dock Beta]
The pale gray walls, floor, and ceiling of this massive EAOS docking bay glow
with a pale white light. Though the bay remains open to space, it somehow also
retains its atmosphere. Outside, against the starry expanse of space, you can
see the bright glint of a solitary blue-white star. A sign indicates that the
main concourse is to the west, and the doorway to a rare starship supply store
is to the south, but it has been closed and securely locked.
The three-person clipper "Firestorm" is landed here.
You can go west.

but it's putting up a fight."

ftl old earth
Earthgate Station dominates space here, acting as a watchpost for the approach
to Old Earth.
Old Earth turns below you, blue and green and brown and white. The planet
elicits a feeling of "home" in almost all who view it, even if they have never
actually set foot on it.
The computer announces, "Autolander beacon detected. The ship will automatically
proceed to Old Earth in thirty seconds unless aborted or another navigation
order is entered."

Via general sector communication, Old Earth transmits, "Greetings, Firestorm!

peer out
You peer out...
[Old Earth; Manhattan Spaceport]
Welcome to Manhattan Spaceport! The entire place seems brand new, the glass
sparkling, the plasteel gleaming. Starships arrive and depart while others sit
on individual pads, rings of lights blinking around them as they are recharged.
Occasionally, the ground vibrates and the low rumble of heavy hydraulics is
heard as a starship is brought up from the underground garage or lowered for
extended parking below. Around the huge landing pad, wide, arched doorways
framed in brushed steel lead to various station services: Repair & Rearm to the
northeast, Supply to the southeast, Station Security to the southwest, and the
Mail Room to the northwest. In addition, a classy lighted sign over one doorway
reads, 'Pilot Lounge.' You can GO into it. There is also a doorway marked
'Liaison Office' that you can also GO into. Over the corridor to the south,
another sign reads 'Spaceport Exit and Express Train.'
The three-person clipper "Firestorm" is landed here.
You see an asteroid-shaped steel trash bin, a personal hoverpallet, and Chuck
the humanoid service robot here.
You can go north, northeast, east, southeast, south, southwest, west, northwest,
and down.

engineering tool case, a black flightbag with a red shooting star on the side, a

[Starship "Firestorm"; Control Room]
The control room is the hub of every starship. Large metal conduits protect
thick bundles of wires carrying information from every part of the ship to this
one location. A large transparisteel viewport provides a view out the front of
the ship, but experienced pilots in space will have eyes only for the large
starmap dominating the right side of the room. Standing before the viewport is
the main control board, providing essential functions like the shipwide power
lever and alert status. Secondary control boards can be pulled up and folded
back to provide a working surface, or pulled down from recesses overhead as
needed. Though the room is spacious enough for a few others to sit or stand, the
entire architecture of the room is built around the small space before the
control board and the person who will stand there: the starship's pilot. The
status lights overhead are currently not receiving power. Looking through the
windows, you see that the ship is in a garage.
You see a black leather captain's chair, a decoy beacon launcher, a
bioaugmentation plant in a small pot labeled "Space Invaders", and a wormhole
drive tracer here.
You can go south, up, and out.

cola on my computer.

[MTTS] andawn: How much would say, a league pilot, know about fringe or AEU
polotics?
[MTTS] canpher: I'm going to have to hit google hard later since I'm not very
smart.
[MTTS] something: I'm guessing a pilot could find a lot of this out if they
really wanted to?
[MTTS] Squidmind: That's a difficult question to answer due to the nature of
what you're asking.  How much would a German citizen know about Australian
politics?
[MTTS] andawn: But how much, say, would the fringe dictatorship sensor
information on the other alliance's polaticks systems.
[MTTS] something: I mean, if they're a well informed person who cares about
politics.
[MTTS] Squidmind: Yes, if someone actually took the effort to find it out, they
could easily learn about the intricacies of how the governments of the other
alliances worked.
[MTTS] alc_71: I am guessing it would depend on the interest of each individual
pilot. Some are just not into politics and so would maybe only know what they
have to know about their own politics.
[MTTS] Squidmind: The average non-pilot probably doesn't know much about the
other alliances at all since they have no contact with them.
[MTTS] canpher: I'm probably only going to really look into the bits that align
with my character's outlook.
[MTTS] Squidmind: Civilian pilots, members of the governments, and people who
have reason to interact with the other alliances, would be the ones who'd have
reason to gain the knowledge.

[Starship "Firestorm"; Control Room]
The control room is the hub of every starship. Large metal conduits protect
thick bundles of wires carrying information from every part of the ship to this
one location. A large transparisteel viewport provides a view out the front of
the ship, but experienced pilots in space will have eyes only for the large
starmap dominating the right side of the room. Standing before the viewport is
the main control board, providing essential functions like the shipwide power
lever and alert status. Secondary control boards can be pulled up and folded
back to provide a working surface, or pulled down from recesses overhead as
needed. Though the room is spacious enough for a few others to sit or stand, the
entire architecture of the room is built around the small space before the
control board and the person who will stand there: the starship's pilot. The
status lights overhead are currently not receiving power. Looking through the
windows, you see that the ship is in a garage.
You see a black leather captain's chair, a decoy beacon launcher, a
bioaugmentation plant in a small pot labeled "Space Invaders", and a wormhole
drive tracer here.
You can go south, up, and out.

Recent AEU Headlines

* Hyperion Under Lockdown: Multiple Explosions in Jacktown and Primary Spaceport
Injure 23; Terrorism Suspected [10 August 2317] (ISN)
Return to the category menu? [Enter `yes' or `no']
A metallic silver metachannel FTL communicator beeps insistently as it receives
a new notice.
read comm
You return your metallic gold touch einrophone to the main screen.
read comm
You glance at your communicator's screen.
Notice from the Space Defense Captain: Pilots, as we enter the last ten days of
the term, I wanted to congratulate everyone for doing a great job. If my
accounting is accurate, we only lost three ships this term, and only two of
those were lost in combat. Since those losses, we've done a great job responding
to sector alerts, and we even responded to an attack on Accord command --
something I hope they'll remember about us, regardless of what else may happen.
We've also been putting up great beacon numbers. It has been a while since the
last update, but I want to say that about 45% of the beacons done this term have
been done on AEU ships, which is a higher number than I've ever seen. Part of
this may be due to the extended absence of other pilots, but the work we've done
is still nothing to sneeze at. Finally, I'd like to thank the new pilots for
their help in keeping our home sectors free of RATs as much as possible.
Celebrate our collective success by doing a fighter beacon or two in these last
few conquests of the term -- remember that troubled times are ahead, and keeping
our skills sharp may help us all in the long run. [19:55 10 August 2317 GST]
[General Communication] Evenia an Eachtrannach transmits, "If anyone sees
Eli...Stop him before he goes nova."
l
[Starship "Firestorm"; Control Room]
The control room is the hub of every starship. Large metal conduits protect
thick bundles of wires carrying information from every part of the ship to this
one location. A large transparisteel viewport provides a view out the front of
the ship, but experienced pilots in space will have eyes only for the large
starmap dominating the right side of the room. Standing before the viewport is
the main control board, providing essential functions like the shipwide power
lever and alert status. Secondary control boards can be pulled up and folded
back to provide a working surface, or pulled down from recesses overhead as
needed. Though the room is spacious enough for a few others to sit or stand, the
entire architecture of the room is built around the small space before the
control board and the person who will stand there: the starship's pilot. The
status lights overhead are currently not receiving power. Looking through the
windows, you see that the ship is in a garage.
You see a black leather captain's chair, a decoy beacon launcher, a
bioaugmentation plant in a small pot labeled "Space Invaders", and a wormhole
drive tracer here.
You can go south, up, and out.
power
You grasp a large lever on the control board and push it slowly away from you.
Status lights blink on all around you as faint hums and beeps begin to emanate
from the various starship systems.
power
You pull a large lever towards you.
The faint sounds and status lights of the starship's systems slowly fade away,
leaving you in a dim silence.
Your ship 'Firestorm' has been automatically moved into a garage.

l
[Starship "Striking Distance"; Control Room]
The control room is the hub of every starship. Large metal conduits protect
thick bundles of wires carrying information from every part of the ship to this
one location. A large transparisteel viewport provides a view out the front of
the ship, but experienced pilots in space will have eyes only for the large
starmap dominating the right side of the room. Standing before the viewport is
the main control board, providing essential functions like the shipwide power
lever and alert status. Secondary control boards can be pulled up and folded
back to provide a working surface, or pulled down from recesses overhead as
needed. Though the room is spacious enough for a few others to sit or stand, the
entire architecture of the room is built around the small space before the
control board and the person who will stand there: the starship's pilot. Lights
overhead indicate that the ship is on green status. Looking through the windows,
you see that the ship is at The Torus; Dock Alpha.
You see a black leather captain's chair, a wormhole drive tracer, and a decoy
beacon launcher here.
Constantine Stone is standing here.
You can go up and out.

Providence Station shines brightly in the dark, one of the few stations that
bothers to illuminate its outer hull. The gleaming hull of the station is bathed
with bright white floodlights.
New Earth rotates through space before you, a startingly verdant planet, colored
in greens and blues with pure white clouds.

proceed to New Earth in thirty seconds unless aborted or another navigation
order is entered."

l
[Starship "Kalina"; Control Room]
The control room is the hub of every starship. Large metal conduits protect
thick bundles of wires carrying information from every part of the ship to this
one location. A large transparisteel viewport provides a view out the front of
the ship, but experienced pilots in space will have eyes only for the large
starmap dominating the right side of the room. Standing before the viewport is
the main control board, providing essential functions like the shipwide power
lever and alert status. Secondary control boards can be pulled up and folded
back to provide a working surface, or pulled down from recesses overhead as
needed. Though the room is spacious enough for a few others to sit or stand, the
entire architecture of the room is built around the small space before the
control board and the person who will stand there: the starship's pilot. Lights
overhead indicate that the ship is on green status. Looking through the windows,
you see that the ship is in space.
You see a tiger stripe leather sofa, a soft rectangular white rug with a design
of black and cinnamon brown cats, and a black leather captain's chair here.
You can go south and out.
ftl torus
Which sector did you mean?
[1] Torus Corridor (EAOS)
[2] The Torus (EAOS)

What was once a feature of interstellar geography is now the name of an
alliance, and the heart of Fringe space can be found past this gateway. The tiny
station of Nuevo Laredo stands guard here.
The planet of Chetumal floats before you here, the richest planet among the
Fringe Worlds, although that isn't saying a lot.
The computer announces, "Autolander beacon detected. The ship will automatically
proceed to Chetumal in thirty seconds unless aborted or another navigation order
is entered."

l
[Starship "Firestorm"; Control Room]
The control room is the hub of every starship. Large metal conduits protect
thick bundles of wires carrying information from every part of the ship to this
one location. A large transparisteel viewport provides a view out the front of
the ship, but experienced pilots in space will have eyes only for the large
starmap dominating the right side of the room. Standing before the viewport is
the main control board, providing essential functions like the shipwide power
lever and alert status. Secondary control boards can be pulled up and folded
back to provide a working surface, or pulled down from recesses overhead as
needed. Though the room is spacious enough for a few others to sit or stand, the
entire architecture of the room is built around the small space before the
control board and the person who will stand there: the starship's pilot. The
status lights overhead are currently not receiving power. Looking through the
windows, you see that the ship is in a garage.
You see a black leather captain's chair, a decoy beacon launcher, a
bioaugmentation plant in a small pot labeled "Space Invaders", and a wormhole
drive tracer here.
You can go south, up, and out.

[The Torus; Dock Alpha]
The pale gray walls, floor, and ceiling of this massive EAOS docking bay glow
with a pale white light. Though the bay remains open to space, it somehow also
retains its atmosphere. Outside, you can see the bright glint of a solitary
blue-white star. Signs indicate that the repair and rearm facility, the starship
supply store, and the main concourse are to the north.
The two-person medium transport "Kalliste", the two-person medium transport
"Registered Merchant 226", and the two-person light transport "Registered
Merchant 390" are landed here.

You tap at your metallic gold touch einrophone and a tiny holoemitter comes to
life.
From a phone-based holoemitter: A floating Public Access logo appears next to
the words "Public Access HV."
From a phone-based holoemitter: Rogue Pilot Eli Grey turns to the camera, eyes
rimmed in red. "Greetings once again citizens of the Union, and of the galaxy."
From a phone-based holoemitter: Eli is plain and has a slightly pudgy build,
fair skin, grey eyes, and mid-back length mirror finish chrome hair and he
stands about five feet and ten inches tall and looks to be in his late twenties.
He is wearing a long white coat, a long-sleeved shirt of steel gray synthcotton,
a pair of close-fitting steel gray synthcotton pants, and a pair of black
synthleather ship boots.
From a phone-based holoemitter: Rogue Pilot Eli Grey says, "Tonights broadcast
will be a little different, as you can see. We are abord my transport Grey Sky."
From a phone-based holoemitter: Eli gestures at the planet of New earth, visible
through the viewport.
From a phone-based holoemitter: Rogue Pilot Eli Grey says, "I almost thought of
calling off this broadcast tonight, after the tragic events of today. There are
some that may say that I should have. Make no mistake, that we do what we do
tonight, with a heavy heart indeed."
You notice that your hair is now mid-back length.
From a phone-based holoemitter: Rogue Pilot Eli Grey says, "The tragic bombing
of my hometown, is something that will be forever burned into my memory. Those
that have done this terrible thing, have done so out of desperation. A
desperation that so many of us have felt lately. I do not condone their actions,
but I understand them."
From a phone-based holoemitter: Rogue Pilot Eli Grey says, "I have decided to
move forward, with something we have been planning for oever a week now, in the
hopes that it will prevent others from feeling that they need to act in similar
ways."

touch einrophone ringing.

post in AEU/Debate.

into deep space to bring home valuable resources for the alliance. She even once
assisted in relieve a drought on the planet of Hyperion."

g
A high warbling alarm suddenly goes off. Speaking over it, the computer
announces, "Fatal hit received. Occupants must stand by for emergency ejection."
You suddenly float up into the air as the ship's artificial gravity abruptly
switches off, and you feel your hair stand on end as the ship projects an
electromagnetic field around you. Suddenly, every seam of the ship seems to come
apart, exposing you to space. You quickly close your eyes as the vacuum pulls at
your skin and the electromagnetic field tugs you rapidly toward a starship
rescue pod.
[Kalliste Rescue Pod]
You can go nowhere.
The pod simply drifts for a moment as its automatic navigation systems come
online. Then it smoothly maneuvers through the wreckage of the starship and out
into open space.
You bring up a tiny screen of flight controls with a mere handful of selections
on it.
Please choose a destination:

[2] The Torus
[3] New Earth
[4] Old Earth
[5] Chetumal
[6] Space Station "Helios"
[7] Accord of Free Worlds Command

The computer reports that the Grey Sky rescue pod has jumped out of the sector.
2
The computer announces, "New destination set: The Torus."
l
[Kalliste Rescue Pod]
This pod is rather cramped quarters, consisting of a circle of seats with
harnesses to secure the occupants. Space is saved by the almost total lack of
any sort of flight control whatsoever, although a tiny starmap display and a
very few other status readouts are available. Equipment thrums under your feet,
where the flight computer and the pod's various drives are housed. Lights
overhead indicate that the ship is on green status. Looking through the windows,
you see that the ship is in space. The hatch appears to be locked.
You see a gray leather captain's chair and a "Kalliste" salvage container here.
You can go nowhere.
The ship rapidly heads toward a planet.
peer out
You peer out...
[New Earth; Spaceport Landing Pad]
The busy landing pad of New Earth's capital city's spaceport sits over a large
bay at the tip of the southern continent. The pad itself is a huge square sheet
of white plasteel surrounded by gleaming new starship service structures. On the
southern side of the pad is a circular structure with wide transparisteel
windows affording a fabulous view of the ocean. A softly lit sign over the
transparisteel doorway reads, 'Pilot Lounge,' and a separate doorway is marked
'Liaison Office.' It looks like you can GO into either of those places. To the
west, a bridge spans the gap between the landing pad and the rest of the
spaceport.
The Kalliste rescue pod is landed here.
You see an automatic teller machine and a small trash can here.
You can go north, south, west, and down.
Rescue workers quickly empty the landed rescue pod.
[New Earth; Spaceport Landing Pad]
The Kalliste rescue pod is landed here.
You see an automatic teller machine and a small trash can here.
You can go north, south, west, and down.
Spaceport workers efficiently haul the spent pod out of the way.

l
[Starship "Fearless"; Control Room]
The control room is the hub of every starship. Large metal conduits protect
thick bundles of wires carrying information from every part of the ship to this
one location. A large transparisteel viewport provides a view out the front of
the ship, but experienced pilots in space will have eyes only for the large
starmap dominating the right side of the room. Standing before the viewport is
the main control board, providing essential functions like the shipwide power
lever and alert status. Secondary control boards can be pulled up and folded
back to provide a working surface, or pulled down from recesses overhead as
needed. Though the room is spacious enough for a few others to sit or stand, the
entire architecture of the room is built around the small space before the
control board and the person who will stand there: the starship's pilot. The
status lights overhead are currently not receiving power. Looking through the
windows, you see that the ship is in a garage.
You see a black leather captain's chair, a discount beacon launcher, a wormhole
drive tracer, and a greater minimodule of projectile boost here.
You can go up and out.
peer out
Not much to see out there.

those costs.

a lot of early points and credits!

l
[Starship "Firestorm"; Control Room]
The control room is the hub of every starship. Large metal conduits protect
thick bundles of wires carrying information from every part of the ship to this
one location. A large transparisteel viewport provides a view out the front of
the ship, but experienced pilots in space will have eyes only for the large
starmap dominating the right side of the room. Standing before the viewport is
the main control board, providing essential functions like the shipwide power
lever and alert status. Secondary control boards can be pulled up and folded
back to provide a working surface, or pulled down from recesses overhead as
needed. Though the room is spacious enough for a few others to sit or stand, the
entire architecture of the room is built around the small space before the
control board and the person who will stand there: the starship's pilot. The
status lights overhead are currently not receiving power. Looking through the
windows, you see that the ship is in a garage.
You see a black leather captain's chair, a decoy beacon launcher, a
bioaugmentation plant in a small pot labeled "Space Invaders", and a wormhole
drive tracer here.
You can go south, up, and out.
power
You grasp a large lever on the control board and push it slowly away from you.
Status lights blink on all around you as faint hums and beeps begin to emanate
from the various starship systems.
power
You pull a large lever towards you.
The faint sounds and status lights of the starship's systems slowly fade away,
leaving you in a dim silence.
Your ship 'Firestorm' has been automatically moved into a garage.
read comm
You glance at your communicator's screen.
There are no notices.
launch
The navigation systems are nonfunctional until their power is restored.
power
You grasp a large lever on the control board and push it slowly away from you.
Status lights blink on all around you as faint hums and beeps begin to emanate
from the various starship systems.
launch
You use the ship's radio to ask flight control for launch clearance.
A voice comes over the speaker and says, "Firestorm, you are given undock
clearance under the AEU-EAOS non-aggression pact."
ftl new
The ship is already moving.
ftl new
The ship is already moving.
ftl new
Providence Station shines brightly in the dark, one of the few stations that
bothers to illuminate its outer hull. The gleaming hull of the station is bathed
with bright white floodlights.
New Earth rotates through space before you, a startingly verdant planet, colored
in greens and blues with pure white clouds.
The computer announces, "Autolander beacon detected. The ship will automatically
proceed to New Earth in thirty seconds unless aborted or another navigation
order is entered."

y
You pay 11,000.00 AEU credits, and are informed that a suborbital pod will
arrive within two minutes.
Your ship 'Firestorm' has been automatically moved into a garage.
[Suborbital Pod: New Phoenix to Landfall]
You can go nowhere.
As soon as you board the pod, it launches from the station, beginning a long arc
above the surface.
The suborbital pod reaches the top of its arc, coming to a gradual stop before
beginning to plummet back to the surface.
The pod's braking thrusters suddenly kick in, abruptly slowing the pod as it
nears the surface.
The pod settles onto the ground, and you depart.

[Landfall; Memorial Road]
One of the busiest streets in Landfall, Memorial Road stretches nearly all the
way across town. A large building here houses the expansive, historical Ingrid
Kirkpatrick Museum. Memorial Road continues to the southeast.
You can go north and southeast.
se
[Landfall; Memorial Road]
You can go east, south, and northwest.
l
[Landfall; Memorial Road]
One of the busiest streets in Landfall, Memorial Road stretches nearly all the
way across town. A classic, heavily-frequented restaurant called Helga's Diner
is here. A constant stream of customers move in and out, many carrying take-out
boxes. South of here is famous Mendes Market, home to many of Landfall's most
beloved shops.
You can go east, south, and northwest.
s
[Landfall; Mendes Market]
You see an automatic teller machine here.
You can go north, east, and west.

[Landfall; Mendes Market]
The famous Mendes Market is bustling with life and culture. The market extends
east and west from here, each arm of the market offering shops and sights that
shouldn't be missed.
You see an automatic teller machine here.
You can go north, east, and west.

head, face, both eyes, neck, both wrists, and both hands are left uncovered.
You are carrying nothing.

the windows, you see that the ship is in a garage.
You see a soft round ocean blue rug with a design of coral and turquoise
seashells, a blueberry rattan bench with a long white and coral pink flowered
cushion on it, a round white rattan dining table with a glass top, a blueberry
rattan bench with a long white and coral pink flowered cushion and Shine the
sleeping big white glowing felo on it, a rattan floor lamp with a coral lotus
shade, a blueberry rattan pantry cabinet, a small dusky pink trash bin, a glossy
azure blue ceramic felo chow bowl, a hairy yellow eight-legged ArachnoPal named
Higgins, Cheri-Pye the large light violet felo, and a black plastic tray of
spider chow here.
You can go north, east, south, west, up, and down.

full of spider chow.

a round white rattan coffee table with a glass top

table has an unbreakable glass top supported by open arches of medium-weight
rattan.

purple bow, a bag of felo treats, a bag of felo treats, a bag of felo treats, a

plastic tray of spider chow, a black plastic tray of spider chow, a container of

[Starship "William Dove"; Control Room]
The control room is the hub of every starship. Large metal conduits protect
thick bundles of wires carrying information from every part of the ship to this
one location. A large transparisteel viewport provides a view out the front of
the ship, but experienced pilots in space will have eyes only for the large
starmap dominating the right side of the room. Standing before the viewport is
the main control board, providing essential functions like the shipwide power
lever and alert status. Secondary control boards can be pulled up and folded
back to provide a working surface, or pulled down from recesses overhead as
needed. Though the room is spacious enough for a few others to sit or stand, the
entire architecture of the room is built around the small space before the
control board and the person who will stand there: the starship's pilot. The
status lights overhead are currently not receiving power. Looking through the
windows, you see that the ship is in a garage.
You see a sleek metal quantum entanglement communication device, a rattan floor
lamp with a light purple lotus shade (casting a white-colored glow), a wormhole
drive tracer, a dark purple leather captain's chair, a large oval white and
black cloth rug, a rare black EAOSian contoured couch with a hand-made white and
sapphire star quilt on it, a round white rattan coffee table with a glass top, a
glossy silver ceramic felo chow bowl, a wall-sized bubbling neon purple-lit
aquarium containing yellow and red aquatic life and coral rocks, a small white
trash bin, a high tech silver star print holovid, a bulky silver-colored
posterizer, a black plastic tray of spider chow, and Purr the humanoid service
robot here.
You can go south and out.
Prissy the big violet long-haired felo wanders in from the south.
[General Communication] A space bus driver transmits, "Space Bus 213 to Nouveau
Quebec now boarding at Space Station "Foxtrot"! Departure in one Earth hour!"
Prissy the big violet long-haired felo wanders out.
A large semi-transparent spherical creature with long dangling tendrils and a
blue glowing interior drifts slowly across the tank.

ftl chetumal
Your ship 'William Dove' has been automatically moved into a garage.
What was once a feature of interstellar geography is now the name of an
alliance, and the heart of Fringe space can be found past this gateway. The tiny
station of Nuevo Laredo stands guard here.
The planet of Chetumal floats before you here, the richest planet among the
Fringe Worlds, although that isn't saying a lot.
The computer announces, "Autolander beacon detected. The ship will automatically
proceed to Chetumal in thirty seconds unless aborted or another navigation order
is entered."
Via general sector communication, Chetumal transmits, "Greetings, Firestorm!
Welcome to Chetumal Orbit!"

actually set foot on it.

order is entered."

Lily Kaise, Phoenix Dissident
She appears to be 28 years old. She is about five feet and two inches tall and
has fair skin. Her body is thin with attractively curved hips and shapely
calves. She has slender shoulders and slightly larger than average breasts. Her
face is oval and pretty, with a delicate nose and understated chin. Her lips are
lovely and blush pink and occasionally part to reveal a set of pretty teeth.
Beneath a set of arched eyebrows, her eyes are blue-green and almond-shaped. Her
mid-back length, straight hair is pale honey blonde and swept up into a thick
fall of loose curls down her back. She has oval pink fingernails.
A small enameled cerulean blue dragonfly pierces her left earlobe and a small
enameled cerulean blue dragonfly pierces her right earlobe.
 She is wearing a sleeveless lilac cotton top with scalloped edges, a pair of
blue stonewashed denim jeans with a small dark red 'XX' embroidered on the left
front pocket, and a pair of soft light blue slippers. She is also wearing an
orange and white blessed prayer bracelet around her wrist, a slender bracelet of
tiny tinkling silver bells around her wrist, a neon purple wrist-mounted
chronometer, a solid silver ring engraved with dragonflies, a delicate ring of
silver wire and small purple amethyst crystals, a metallic gold touch einrophone
in a metallic purple reinforced plastic phone holster, an elegant white gold
ring inset with a perfect solitaire diamond, a light purple flightbag with a
pastel kitten on the side, a soft fuchsia Tardick lizard snuggly labeled
'Asteria', and a Tardick lizard named Asteria perched on her shoulder. Her head,
face, both eyes, neck, both biceps, both elbows, both forearms, both wrists, and
both hands are left uncovered.
She is carrying a milk chocolate heart in her right hand.

Lily Kaise, Phoenix Dissident
She appears to be 28 years old. She is about five feet and two inches tall and
has fair skin. Her body is thin with attractively curved hips and shapely
calves. She has slender shoulders and slightly larger than average breasts. Her
face is oval and pretty, with a delicate nose and understated chin. Her lips are
lovely and blush pink and occasionally part to reveal a set of pretty teeth.
Beneath a set of arched eyebrows, her eyes are blue-green and almond-shaped. Her
mid-back length, straight hair is pale honey blonde and swept up into a thick
fall of loose curls down her back. She has oval pink fingernails.
A small enameled cerulean blue dragonfly pierces her left earlobe and a small
enameled cerulean blue dragonfly pierces her right earlobe.
 She is wearing a sleeveless lilac cotton top with scalloped edges, a pair of
blue stonewashed denim jeans with a small dark red 'XX' embroidered on the left
front pocket, and a pair of soft light blue slippers. She is also wearing an
orange and white blessed prayer bracelet around her wrist, a slender bracelet of
tiny tinkling silver bells around her wrist, a neon purple wrist-mounted
chronometer, a solid silver ring engraved with dragonflies, a delicate ring of
silver wire and small purple amethyst crystals, a metallic gold touch einrophone
in a metallic purple reinforced plastic phone holster, an elegant white gold
ring inset with a perfect solitaire diamond, a light purple flightbag with a
pastel kitten on the side, and a soft fuchsia Tardick lizard snuggly labeled
'Asteria'. Her head, face, both eyes, neck, both biceps, both elbows, both
forearms, both wrists, and both hands are left uncovered.

You see a large round light purple and dark purple cloth rug, an antique oak
table from Old Earth, a textured plasteel floor lamp with a cream shade (casting

felo chow bowl, a wall-sized bubbling coral pink-lit aquarium containing white
and light blue aquatic life and coral rocks, a black plastic tray of spider
chow, and a hairy yellow eight-legged ArachnoPal named Higgins here.

it invigorates your senses.

ftl chetumal
The ship is already moving.
ftl chetumal
Your ship 'William Dove' has been automatically moved into a garage.
What was once a feature of interstellar geography is now the name of an
alliance, and the heart of Fringe space can be found past this gateway. The tiny
station of Nuevo Laredo stands guard here.
The planet of Chetumal floats before you here, the richest planet among the
Fringe Worlds, although that isn't saying a lot.
The computer announces, "Autolander beacon detected. The ship will automatically
proceed to Chetumal in thirty seconds unless aborted or another navigation order
is entered."

Welcome to Chetumal Orbit!"

You begin familiarizing yourself with the engineering stations and making

[Starship "Effervescent Zephyr"; Engineering Room]
The engineering room is much cleaner and sterile than most people expect when
they first board a starship. Though there are some exposed, thick bundles of
wires running here and there, most of the actual workings of the ship are deeper
in its structure. Instead, the room is virtually bare and brightly lit, with one
wall dominated by a large graphical representation of the ship and its
components, alongside current estimates of damage levels. On the right is a
small starmap set into a wall, displaying a bare minimum of information so that
it is not a distraction to the one keeping the ship together. A simple control
board allows the operator to prioritize repairs. The status lights overhead are
currently not receiving power. Looking through the windows, you see that the
ship is in a garage.
You can go north.
Your ship 'Firestorm' has been automatically moved into a garage.

ftl glittering
Providence Station shines brightly in the dark, one of the few stations that
bothers to illuminate its outer hull. The gleaming hull of the station is bathed
with bright white floodlights.
This asteroid belt is unusually close to its star, and the slowly rotating
asteroids glitter brightly in the sunlight.
The computer announces, "Autolander beacon detected. The ship will automatically
proceed to Space Station Delta in thirty seconds unless aborted or another
navigation order is entered."

Firestorm! Welcome to home space!"

marking away.

ftl hyperion
A single star shines brightly in the dark here, the light strangely comforting.
The ship's sensors indicate that the star's spectrum is nearly identical to
Sol's.
Hyperion's famous Sea of Grass is immediately obvious upon gazing at the planet,
the rolling, meters-deep expanse of tall grasses obscuring the contours of the
surface.
Via general sector communication, Hyperion transmits, "Hello there, Firestorm!
Welcome to home space!"

can hold on to it for a little while, I'm sure there's som%one who will take it
off your hands."

[The Torus; Dock Alpha]
The pale gray walls, floor, and ceiling of this massive EAOS docking bay glow
with a pale white light. Though the bay remains open to space, it somehow also
retains its atmosphere. Outside, you can see the bright glint of a solitary
blue-white star. Signs indicate that the repair and rearm facility, the starship
supply store, and the main concourse are to the north.
The three-person clipper "Firestorm" is landed here.

bothers to illuminate its outer hull. The gleaming hull of the station is bathed
with bright white floodlights.

in greens and blues with pure white clouds.

order is entered."

[The Torus; Dock Beta]
The pale gray walls, floor, and ceiling of this massive EAOS docking bay glow
with a pale white light. Though the bay remains open to space, it somehow also
retains its atmosphere. Outside, against the starry expanse of space, you can
see the bright glint of a solitary blue-white star. A sign indicates that the
main concourse is to the west, and the doorway to a rare starship supply store
is to the south, but it has been closed and securely locked.
The five-person A.S.S. tactical platform "William Dove" is landed here.

neck, both wrists, and both hands are left uncovered.

ftl new
Providence Station shines brightly in the dark, one of the few stations that
bothers to illuminate its outer hull. The gleaming hull of the station is bathed
with bright white floodlights.
Your ship 'Israel Hope' has been automatically moved into a garage.
New Earth rotates through space before you, a startingly verdant planet, colored
in greens and blues with pure white clouds.
The computer announces, "Autolander beacon detected. The ship will automatically
proceed to New Earth in thirty seconds unless aborted or another navigation
order is entered."
Via general sector communication, New Earth transmits, "Hello there, Firestorm!
Welcome to home space!"

[Starship "Firestorm"; Control Room]
You see a black leather captain's chair, a decoy beacon launcher, a
bioaugmentation plant in a small pot labeled "Space Invaders", and a wormhole
drive tracer here.
You can go south, up, and out.
power
You grasp a large lever on the control board and push it slowly away from you.
Status lights blink on all around you as faint hums and beeps begin to emanate
from the various starship systems.
launch
You use the ship's radio to ask flight control for launch clearance.
A voice comes over the speaker and says, "Firestorm, you have clearance to
launch. Good luck and come back to us safely."

pleased with yourself over what you all did. Sorry that it may be shocking to
you but everyone doesn't always agree."

285" has jumped into the sector.

Merchant 285! Welcome to home space!"

peer out
You peer out...
[Residential Structure; Docking Bay]
This docking bay is relatively quiet compared to most other similar facilities.
As with other EAOS docking bays, the entire structure appears open to space, yet
no air escapes. Signs indicate that the lobby is on the level above, and
Spaceport facilities are below.
The two-person light transport "Jack Of All Trades" and the three-person clipper
"Firestorm" are landed here.
You can go north, south, up, and down.

[General Communication] Ali Candan transmits, "Ather?"
[General Communication] Rogue Ace Pilot Ather Jammoa transmits, "Yep?"
[General Communication] Ali Candan transmits, "Do you have a few moments?"
[General Communication] Rogue Ace Pilot Ather Jammoa transmits, "Sure."
[General Communication] Ali Candan transmits, "Right. Will be on New Earth in a
few minutes."
[General Communication] Rogue Ace Pilot Ather Jammoa transmits, "Me too!"
[Notification from Space Explorers Amidst The Stars] A load of salvage has been
received at League Salvage Processing Nuclear Autonav Station from the
two-person medium transport "Full Dive". The organization has earned 554,503.09
credits.
[General Communication] Morris Corlew transmits, "Who all's disagreein with the
AEU strike?"
[General Communication] Melinda Michaels transmits, "Just you."
[General Communication] Rogue Ace Pilot Ather Jammoa transmits, "Pretty much!"
[General Communication] Morris Corlew transmits, "Uh no? I asked a question this
mornin."
[General Communication] Joel Kringle transmits, "You did more than ask
questions."
[General Communication] Morris Corlew transmits, "I've been tryin to get some
clarification and asked if they weren't hurtin themselves more than the alliance
and nobody answered."
[General Communication] Melinda Michaels transmits, "Then offered to rent out
your transport?"
[General Communication] Joel Kringle transmits, "And said that they were cutting
off their nose to spite their face?"
[General Communication] Morris Corlew transmits, "So did Eve. Think bout it. 100
mill an hour? Who's gonna pay that. It was a joke and I wouldn't do it."
[General Communication] Morris Corlew transmits, "I asked Joel. I didn't say I
disagreed."
[General Communication] Aisling transmits, "Blowing up their transports was
stupid."
[General Communication] Rogue Ace Pilot Ather Jammoa transmits, "What we do to
ourselves is irrelevant if the alliance doesn't remain in the Accord. You
fferring to rent out your transport was honestly a blatent insult to what we
were trying to accomplish. We, that is to say, those of us who were here were
already prepared for the potential ramifications, but in this case, if the
strike manages to succeed, those ramifications are worth whatever ends up
happening to us."
[General Communication] Evenia an Eachtrannach transmits, "Actually...It was ted
that said he'd rent his for 5 tael."
[General Communication] Morris Corlew transmits, "Ok, yeah, sorry. Ted."
[General Communication] Melinda Michaels transmits, "So you both offered then."
[General Communication] Morris Corlew transmits, "And Ather, I get that. I was
askin questions and no one was answerin. Plus, no I wouldn't really rent out the
transport. It wasn't an offer, it was a joke."
[General Communication] Morris Corlew transmits, "Who in their right mind would
pay that much to rent a transport?"
[General Communication] Melinda Michaels transmits, "Probably not the best time
to be joking with what they are dealing with."
[General Communication] Morris Corlew transmits, "Yeah, you got a point. But I
kept askin questions and nobody had answers...humor's kinda my...fallback."
[General Communication] Joel Kringle transmits, "Then you wait until people
aren't busy."
[General Communication] Melinda Michaels transmits, "It's just gonna cause
headlines that downplay what they are trying to do. Which, it did."

[Old Earth; Manhattan Spaceport]
Welcome to Manhattan Spaceport! The entire place seems brand new, the glass
sparkling, the plasteel gleaming. Starships arrive and depart while others sit
on individual pads, rings of lights blinking around them as they are recharged.
Occasionally, the ground vibrates and the low rumble of heavy hydraulics is
heard as a starship is brought up from the underground garage or lowered for
extended parking below. Around the huge landing pad, wide, arched doorways
framed in brushed steel lead to various station services: Repair & Rearm to the
northeast, Supply to the southeast, Station Security to the southwest, and the
Mail Room to the northwest. In addition, a classy lighted sign over one doorway
reads, 'Pilot Lounge.' You can GO into it. There is also a doorway marked
'Liaison Office' that you can also GO into. Over the corridor to the south,

[Space Station "Helios"; Conference Chamber]
The large, circular room caps the stardock. Rare windows of clear plasteel are
set into the walls, giving a clear view of both the original station, now
completely renovated and fixed to the north, and of the cylindrical
Heliomutamall. The room itself is simple, with a dark grey carpet on the floor
and a large, finely polished black ebony table in the center with numerous
chairs pulled up to it. The colors of the Mutuality are displayed in the bands
of red and black running along the dark metal walls, and in the black and red
banner hanging at one end of the room, displaying the logo of the alliance: a
stylized starship crossed with a chaingun.
You see a heavily reinforced bulky steel projector lying on its side and Manx
the little calico CatBot here.
Evangeline Adaire, Phoenix Dissident, Lily Kaise, Phoenix Dissident, Aisling,
and Anfisa of Marzore are standing here.
You can go down.

ftl mir
The darkened, airless hulk of the Mir space station looms in the distance. Its
existence as a busy neutral port ended abruptly when an Outsider phased
destabilizing beam pierced the center of the station. Clouds of sparkling debris
still mark the weapon's entry and exit points.

Something deep inside the starship roars to life as the lights dim sharply.
A wormhole suddenly appears in front of the ship, its edges tinged an unusual
deep purple. Strange undulating shapes are half-visible deep inside it.
A thick undulating mist suddenly seems to rush toward the starship from every
direction, quickly blotting out the stars. Random shapes, some half-familiar,
occasionally form in the mist only to disappear almost immediately.

and filmy deep purple hangings with a soft periwinkle cashmere blanket, a set of
lavender silk sheets, a large periwinkle bed pillow, a hand-made purple and
amethyst flower quilt, and a large periwinkle bed pillow on it.

[Starship "William Dove"; Observation Deck]
You see a large round light purple and dark purple cloth rug, an antique oak
table from Old Earth, a textured plasteel floor lamp with a cream shade (casting
a white-colored glow), a violet leather sectional sofa, a glossy lilac ceramic
felo chow bowl, a wall-sized bubbling coral pink-lit aquarium containing white
and light blue aquatic life and coral rocks, a black plastic tray of spider
chow, and Shine the big white glowing felo here.
You can go north, east, south, west, up, and down.
open suit
You open a small suitcase.
get briefs from suit

wear briefs

wear jeans

wear polo

get white socks
You remove a pair of white socks from a small suitcase.
wear socks
You slide a pair of white socks onto your feet.
get sneakers

wear sneakers

close suit
You close a small suitcase.
put suit in briefcase

[Starship "William Dove"; Control Room]
You see a sleek metal quantum entanglement communication device, a rattan floor
lamp with a light purple lotus shade (casting a white-colored glow), a wormhole
drive tracer, a dark purple leather captain's chair, a large oval white and
black cloth rug, a rare black EAOSian contoured couch with a hand-made white and

trash bin, a high tech silver star print holovid, a bulky silver-colored
posterizer, a black plastic tray of spider chow, Purr the humanoid service
robot, a compact white refrigerator, and an insulated black cooler here.

You can't go that way.

[Starship "Firestorm"; Control Room]
You see a black leather captain's chair, a decoy beacon launcher, a

power
You grasp a large lever on the control board and push it slowly away from you.
Status lights blink on all around you as faint hums and beeps begin to emanate
from the various starship systems.
launch
You use the ship's radio to ask flight control for launch clearance.
A voice comes over the speaker and says, "Firestorm, you are given undock
clearance under the AEU-EAOS non-aggression pact."
ftl chetumal
What was once a feature of interstellar geography is now the name of an
alliance, and the heart of Fringe space can be found past this gateway. The tiny
station of Nuevo Laredo stands guard here.
The planet of Chetumal floats before you here, the richest planet among the
Fringe Worlds, although that isn't saying a lot.
The computer announces, "Autolander beacon detected. The ship will automatically
proceed to Chetumal in thirty seconds unless aborted or another navigation order
is entered."

Providence Station shines brightly in the dark, one of the few stations that
bothers to illuminate its outer hull. The gleaming hull of the station is bathed
with bright white floodlights.
New Earth rotates through space before you, a startingly verdant planet, colored
in greens and blues with pure white clouds.

proceed to New Earth in thirty seconds unless aborted or another navigation
order is entered."

l
[Starship "William Dove"; Control Room]
The control room is the hub of every starship. Large metal conduits protect
thick bundles of wires carrying information from every part of the ship to this
one location. A large transparisteel viewport provides a view out the front of
the ship, but experienced pilots in space will have eyes only for the large
starmap dominating the right side of the room. Standing before the viewport is
the main control board, providing essential functions like the shipwide power
lever and alert status. Secondary control boards can be pulled up and folded
back to provide a working surface, or pulled down from recesses overhead as
needed. Though the room is spacious enough for a few others to sit or stand, the
entire architecture of the room is built around the small space before the
control board and the person who will stand there: the starship's pilot. The
status lights overhead are currently not receiving power. Looking through the
windows, you see that the ship is in a garage.
You see a sleek metal quantum entanglement communication device, a rattan floor
lamp with a light purple lotus shade (casting a white-colored glow), a wormhole
drive tracer, a dark purple leather captain's chair, a large oval white and
black cloth rug, a rare black EAOSian contoured couch with a hand-made white and
sapphire star quilt on it, a round white rattan coffee table with a glass top, a
glossy silver ceramic felo chow bowl, a wall-sized bubbling neon purple-lit
aquarium containing yellow and red aquatic life and coral rocks, a small white
trash bin, a high tech silver star print holovid, a bulky silver-colored
posterizer, a black plastic tray of spider chow, Purr the humanoid service
robot, a compact white refrigerator, and an insulated black cooler here.
Lily Kaise, Phoenix Dissident is sitting on a rare black EAOSian contoured
couch.
You can go south and out.
(You are sitting on a rare black EAOSian contoured couch with a hand-made white
and sapphire star quilt on it.)

pushes it slowly away from her.

from the various starship systems.

launch clearance.

clearance under the AEU-EAOS non-aggression pact."

control board.
Providence Station shines brightly in the dark, one of the few stations that
bothers to illuminate its outer hull. The gleaming hull of the station is bathed
with bright white floodlights.
New Earth rotates through space before you, a startingly verdant planet, colored
in greens and blues with pure white clouds.
The computer announces, "Autolander beacon detected. The ship will automatically
proceed to New Earth in thirty seconds unless aborted or another navigation
order is entered."

Dove! Welcome to home space!"

navigation controls.
