green
You lift a small plastic cover and press a green button.
You hear a single beep and glance up to see green lights flick on overhead as
the ship enters normal status.
A low hum you had barely noticed until now slowly fades away as weapons are
powered down.

[Starship "William Dove"; Control Room]
You see a sleek metal quantum entanglement communication device, a rattan floor
lamp with a light purple lotus shade (casting a white-colored glow), a wormhole
drive tracer, a dark purple leather captain's chair, a large oval white and
black cloth rug, a rare black EAOSian contoured couch with a hand-made white and
sapphire star quilt on it, a round white rattan coffee table with a glass top, a
glossy silver ceramic felo chow bowl, a wall-sized bubbling neon purple-lit
aquarium containing yellow and red aquatic life and coral rocks, a small white
trash bin, a high tech silver star print holovid, a black plastic tray of spider
chow, Purr the humanoid service robot, a compact white refrigerator, an

candidacy.

you nominate yourself. The nomination process will last for two days before
voting begins.

of exploration points, not very many aggregate points, not very many industry
points, and not very many ground combat points.
Related to industry, you are the best with asteroid hauls, inexperienced with
Teslatown activities, very inexperienced with belt management, very
inexperienced with salvages, very inexperienced with deliveries, very
inexperienced with asteroid mining, very inexperienced with passengers, very
inexperienced with atmospheric scooping, very inexperienced with salvage
operations, and very inexperienced with trading.
Related to starship combat, you are the best at combat gunning, good with
mission-related ship kills, good at combat piloting, very inexperienced at
advanced engineering techniques, very inexperienced at defending salvage
operations, very inexperienced with minor skirmish ship kills, and very
inexperienced with invading ship kills.
Related to ground combat, you are good with weapon hits, inexperienced with
kills, and very inexperienced with ground missions.
Related to exploration, you are very good with planetary probes, good with deep
space probes, inexperienced with planetary finds, inexperienced at the
exploration of the Glyphmaker ruins, inexperienced at analyzing deep space
finds, inexperienced with space imaging, inexperienced with local artifact
finds, inexperienced with alien artifact finds, and very inexperienced with
assisted planetary finds.

You see a large round light purple and dark purple cloth rug, an antique oak

felo chow bowl, a wall-sized bubbling coral pink-lit aquarium containing white
and light blue aquatic life and coral rocks, a black plastic tray of spider
chow, a Tardick lizard named Asteria, and Shine the big white glowing felo here.
You can go north, east, south, west, up, and down.

 You are wearing a soft red heather cotton polo, a pair of blue corduroy jeans,
and a pair of gray canvas sneakers. Underneath this, you are wearing a pair of
white socks and a pair of white cotton briefs. You are also wearing a keychain,
a backpack, a metallic gold touch einrophone in a black leather phone holster, a
solid silver ring engraved with dolphins, and a gold wrist-mounted chronometer.
You are concealing a metallic silver metachannel FTL communicator, a flight
control scanner, a large expandable telescoping xenology container, a scorched
metal thigh holster, a golden Feng Wo coin purse, a camera bag, a black
engineering tool case, a black flightbag with a red shooting star on the side, a
leather briefcase, and a thick synthleather bandolier with large pockets. Your
head, face, both eyes, neck, both elbows, both forearms, both wrists, and both
hands are left uncovered.
You are carrying nothing.

ftl chetumal
What was once a feature of interstellar geography is now the name of an
alliance, and the heart of Fringe space can be found past this gateway. The tiny
station of Nuevo Laredo stands guard here.
The planet of Chetumal floats before you here, the richest planet among the
Fringe Worlds, although that isn't saying a lot.
The computer announces, "Autolander beacon detected. The ship will automatically
proceed to Chetumal in thirty seconds unless aborted or another navigation order
is entered."
Via general sector communication, Chetumal transmits, "Greetings, Firestorm!
Welcome to Chetumal Orbit!"

non-aggression pact."

ftl new
Providence Station shines brightly in the dark, one of the few stations that
bothers to illuminate its outer hull. The gleaming hull of the station is bathed
with bright white floodlights.
New Earth rotates through space before you, a startingly verdant planet, colored
in greens and blues with pure white clouds.
The computer announces, "Autolander beacon detected. The ship will automatically
proceed to New Earth in thirty seconds unless aborted or another navigation
order is entered."
Via general sector communication, New Earth transmits, "Hello there, Firestorm!
Welcome to home space!"
The ship's computer automatically requests landing clearance.
A voice comes over the speaker and says, "Hello, Firestorm. We read your AEU
transponder. You are cleared to land at the city of New Phoenix."
The computer sounds a notification indicating that the ship has been fully
charged.
power
You pull a large lever towards you.
The faint sounds and status lights of the starship's systems slowly fade away,
leaving you in a dim silence.

Which sector did you mean?
[1] The Shoulder of Orion (Unclaimed)
[2] The Belt of Orion (Unclaimed)
Enter your selection:
2
A pair of odd-colored stars, one green and one blue, mark this curious area of
space. The sensors are picking up odd bits of noise that the ship's computer
insists on trying to convert to audio. Once in a while, something that could
almost sound like a word emerges from a burst of static.
The computer reports that in-sector beacons are transmitting the following:
]?BoB4fqk^yN$8BE//*Hsk>GD)>6L<=uZKfHX[d6
This area of space is within the green belt of the nearest star, but there are
no life-bearing planets here. Instead there is merely an odd cluster of space
stations of unknown origin.
The sensor noise is much worse here, with a constant dark, gutteral snarling
sound emanating from the ship's speakers. It almost sounds like a language, but
it's nothing you've ever heard before, and the ship's computer cannot pinpoint a
source.
The computer announces, "Autolander beacon detected. The ship will automatically
proceed to League Autonavigating Solar Weather Station in thirty seconds unless
aborted or another navigation order is entered."
Via general sector communication, League Autonavigating Solar Weather Station
transmits, "Current riftflow conditions are 2188 light-minutes per second from
Galactic Eastsoutheast and Slightly Down."
ships
Via general sector communication, Beacon E-02 transmits in a robotic voice,
"Detecting vessel 'Firestorm.' Welcome to The Belt of Orion."

[The Torus; Southwest Concourse]

bare gray metal, the walls, meeting seamlessly overhead in an arched ceiling,
glow softly with a pale white light, and the floor is such that it muffles even
the heaviest footfalls. On either side of the corridor is a row of tall windows
that provides on one side a glimpse of the inner curve of the opposite side of
the Torus and, on the other, the sight of the starry black space beyond the
station. Overhead is a large round skylight.
You can go southeast and northwest.
u
You can't go that way.
nw

[The Torus; West Concourse]
Here at the westernmost part of the Torus's West Concourse, a bank of large
windows on the east side of the corridor provides a view of the opposite side of
the station. Spacious, well-lit corridors follow the curve of the station around
to the north and south, while another wide corridor leads west toward Docking
Bay Gamma. Between two windows on the east side of the corridor is the entrance
to the Sanctuary.

Though the curving walls and floor of this spacious corridor seem to be made of

[The Torus; The Arboretum]

l
[The Torus; The Arboretum]
Between the windows on each side of this section of corridor are two arches
perhaps twenty feet high, each one containing a small green tree with lacy
leaves. The trees grow from beneath the floor, their slender, dark brown trunks
emerging from decorative circular grates. While most of the illumination here is
provided by the lighted walls, tiny star-like lights twinkle from the boughs of
the trees. Three doorways on the outer side of the corridor lead to small shops,
one selling souvenirs, the second identified by a brightly lit twinkling sign as
'Holiday Ornamentation,' and the third named 'The Ontological Felo,' which has
articles of oddly shaped clothing in a small display window next to the doorway.
You can go northeast and southwest.
sw
[The Torus; The Arboretum]
You see a trash can here.
You can go northeast and southwest.
l
[The Torus; The Arboretum]
Tall, fragile trees perhaps a hundred feet high grow around the walls of the
Arboretum, their thin boughs of delicate green leaves directed upward in
graceful curves and adorned with tiny, twinkling white lights. Overhead is a
large transparent dome braced with radial plasteel beams, the blackness of space
beyond softened by the uppermost branches of the trees. The floor is paved with
white, silver-laced marble, and in the center of it is another tree, more
substantial than the others and bearing oddly shaped, unpickable red fruit. This
tree is surrounded by masses of exotic flora whose fragrant blossoms scent the
air nearby, with a padded bench encircling the whole arrangement. A small dome
is off to one side, containing a plant that does not look at all terrestrial.
Though some people undoubtedly come here to enjoy the atmosphere, others come to
browse the shops nearby, including a small flower shop and a store with a sign
over the entrance, reading 'Writables.' In addition, a green Scribner's cookie
cart has been set up near the entrance, filling the air with the aroma of
freshly baked sugar cookies.
You see a trash can here.
You can go northeast and southwest.
sw
[The Torus; The Arboretum]
You see a sanitation drone here.
You can go northeast and southwest.

ftl new
Providence Station shines brightly in the dark, one of the few stations that
bothers to illuminate its outer hull. The gleaming hull of the station is bathed
with bright white floodlights.
New Earth rotates through space before you, a startingly verdant planet, colored
in greens and blues with pure white clouds.
The computer announces, "Autolander beacon detected. The ship will automatically
proceed to New Earth in thirty seconds unless aborted or another navigation
order is entered."
Via general sector communication, New Earth transmits, "Hello there, Firestorm!
Welcome to home space!"

navigation order is entered."

Welcome to The Torus!"

wait.

AutoStar (general-purpose starship autopilot) Version 9.1
--
Destinations in this sector:

Enter your destination:
A destination appears on the ship's navigation controls: The Torus (Dock Alpha).
The ship's computer automatically requests docking clearance.
A voice comes over the speaker and says, "We detect you to be an AEU ship,
Firestorm. The EAOS welcomes you under the non-aggression pact."
power
You pull a large lever towards you.
The faint sounds and status lights of the starship's systems slowly fade away,
leaving you in a dim silence.
The computer sounds a notification indicating that the ship has been fully
charged.
Your ship 'Firestorm' has been automatically moved into a garage.

upgrade is needed to install the Torus NDB?"

long-range?"

gemini, but it also hits the Torus. I meant the long range but perhaps that is
the problem."

exploration-grade sensors for that one."

it on carriers and mod transports and things, but oh well."

l
[Starship "Firestorm"; Control Room]
The control room is the hub of every starship. Large metal conduits protect
thick bundles of wires carrying information from every part of the ship to this
one location. A large transparisteel viewport provides a view out the front of
the ship, but experienced pilots in space will have eyes only for the large
starmap dominating the right side of the room. Standing before the viewport is
the main control board, providing essential functions like the shipwide power
lever and alert status. Secondary control boards can be pulled up and folded
back to provide a working surface, or pulled down from recesses overhead as
needed. Though the room is spacious enough for a few others to sit or stand, the
entire architecture of the room is built around the small space before the
control board and the person who will stand there: the starship's pilot. The
status lights overhead are currently not receiving power. Looking through the
windows, you see that the ship is in a garage.
You see a black leather captain's chair, a decoy beacon launcher, a
bioaugmentation plant in a small pot labeled "Space Invaders", and a wormhole
drive tracer here.
You can go south, up, and out.
peer out
Not much to see out there.
i
 You are wearing a soft red heather cotton polo, a pair of blue corduroy jeans,
and a pair of gray canvas sneakers. Underneath this, you are wearing a pair of
white socks and a pair of white cotton briefs. You are also wearing a keychain,
a backpack, a metallic gold touch einrophone in a black leather phone holster, a
solid silver ring engraved with dolphins, and a gold wrist-mounted chronometer.
You are concealing a metallic silver metachannel FTL communicator, a flight
control scanner, a large expandable telescoping xenology container, a scorched
metal thigh holster, a golden Feng Wo coin purse, a camera bag, a black
engineering tool case, a black flightbag with a red shooting star on the side, a
leather briefcase, and a thick synthleather bandolier with large pockets. Your
head, face, both eyes, neck, both elbows, both forearms, both wrists, and both
hands are left uncovered.
You are carrying nothing.
peer s
You peer south...
[Starship "Firestorm"; Engineering Room]
The engineering room is much cleaner and sterile than most people expect when
they first board a starship. Though there are some exposed, thick bundles of
wires running here and there, most of the actual workings of the ship are deeper
in its structure. Instead, the room is virtually bare and brightly lit, with one
wall dominated by a large graphical representation of the ship and its
components, alongside current estimates of damage levels. On the right is a
small starmap set into a wall, displaying a bare minimum of information so that
it is not a distraction to the one keeping the ship together. A simple control
board allows the operator to prioritize repairs. The status lights overhead are
currently not receiving power. Looking through the windows, you see that the
ship is in a garage.
You see a large leather chair, an improved temporary wormhole drive, and an
improved temporary wormhole drive here.
You can go north and down.
out

You see a sleek metal quantum entanglement communication device, a rattan floor
lamp with a light purple lotus shade (casting a white-colored glow), a wormhole
drive tracer, a dark purple leather captain's chair, a large oval white and

glossy silver ceramic felo chow bowl, a wall-sized bubbling neon purple-lit
aquarium containing yellow and red aquatic life and coral rocks, a small white
trash bin, a high tech silver star print holovid, a black plastic tray of spider
chow, a compact white refrigerator, an insulated black cooler, Purr the humanoid
service robot, a pair of white leather clogs with a row of glittery fireflies
across the toes, and Shine the big white glowing felo here.
You can go south and out.

l
[Starship "Supernova"; Control Room]
The control room is the hub of every starship. Large metal conduits protect
thick bundles of wires carrying information from every part of the ship to this
one location. A large transparisteel viewport provides a view out the front of
the ship, but experienced pilots in space will have eyes only for the large
starmap dominating the right side of the room. Standing before the viewport is
the main control board, providing essential functions like the shipwide power
lever and alert status. Secondary control boards can be pulled up and folded
back to provide a working surface, or pulled down from recesses overhead as
needed. Though the room is spacious enough for a few others to sit or stand, the
entire architecture of the room is built around the small space before the
control board and the person who will stand there: the starship's pilot. The
status lights overhead are currently not receiving power. Looking through the
windows, you see that the ship is in a garage.
You see a black leather captain's chair, a decoy beacon launcher, a wormhole
drive tracer, an overstuffed black sofa, a fuzzy stuffed bear, and a viral
injection pylon launcher here.
You can go south and out.
(You are sitting on a black leather captain's chair.)

ftl new
Providence Station shines brightly in the dark, one of the few stations that
bothers to illuminate its outer hull. The gleaming hull of the station is bathed
with bright white floodlights.
New Earth rotates through space before you, a startingly verdant planet, colored
in greens and blues with pure white clouds.
The computer announces, "Autolander beacon detected. The ship will automatically
proceed to New Earth in thirty seconds unless aborted or another navigation
order is entered."

l
[Starship "Firestorm"; Control Room]
The control room is the hub of every starship. Large metal conduits protect
thick bundles of wires carrying information from every part of the ship to this
one location. A large transparisteel viewport provides a view out the front of
the ship, but experienced pilots in space will have eyes only for the large
starmap dominating the right side of the room. Standing before the viewport is
the main control board, providing essential functions like the shipwide power
lever and alert status. Secondary control boards can be pulled up and folded
back to provide a working surface, or pulled down from recesses overhead as
needed. Though the room is spacious enough for a few others to sit or stand, the
entire architecture of the room is built around the small space before the
control board and the person who will stand there: the starship's pilot. The
status lights overhead are currently not receiving power. Looking through the
windows, you see that the ship is in a garage.
You see a black leather captain's chair, a decoy beacon launcher, a
bioaugmentation plant in a small pot labeled "Space Invaders", and a wormhole
drive tracer here.
You can go south, up, and out.
[General Communication] Melinda Michaels transmits, "I am not sure if it will
work out but, let's try the Mutey 4 in case we need some backup reps."
power
You grasp a large lever on the control board and push it slowly away from you.
Status lights blink on all around you as faint hums and beeps begin to emanate
from the various starship systems.
launch
You use the ship's radio to ask flight control for launch clearance.
[General Communication] Ted Warburton transmits, "OK."
A voice comes over the speaker and says, "Firestorm, you have clearance to
launch. Good luck and come back to us safely."

2
A pair of odd-colored stars, one green and one blue, mark this curious area of
space. The sensors are picking up odd bits of noise that the ship's computer
insists on trying to convert to audio. Once in a while, something that could
almost sound like a word emerges from a burst of static.
The computer reports that in-sector beacons are transmitting the following:
7Ck`m8fc!CF+[Ccz_Ix_0Y"%y*qu%=N$V';f\FCj
This area of space is within the green belt of the nearest star, but there are
no life-bearing planets here. Instead there is merely an odd cluster of space
stations of unknown origin.
The sensor noise is much worse here, with a constant dark, gutteral snarling
sound emanating from the ship's speakers. It almost sounds like a language, but
it's nothing you've ever heard before, and the ship's computer cannot pinpoint a
source.
[General Communication] Ted Warburton transmits, "Wait, which one of us are you
proposing Muty 4, me?"

proceed to League Autonavigating Solar Weather Station in thirty seconds unless
aborted or another navigation order is entered."

suit set up?"

[Starship "Firestorm"; Control Room]
The control room is the hub of every starship. Large metal conduits protect
thick bundles of wires carrying information from every part of the ship to this
one location. A large transparisteel viewport provides a view out the front of
the ship, but experienced pilots in space will have eyes only for the large
starmap dominating the right side of the room. Standing before the viewport is
the main control board, providing essential functions like the shipwide power
lever and alert status. Secondary control boards can be pulled up and folded
back to provide a working surface, or pulled down from recesses overhead as
needed. Though the room is spacious enough for a few others to sit or stand, the
entire architecture of the room is built around the small space before the
control board and the person who will stand there: the starship's pilot. The
status lights overhead are currently not receiving power. Looking through the
windows, you see that the ship is in a garage.
You see a black leather captain's chair, a decoy beacon launcher, a
bioaugmentation plant in a small pot labeled "Space Invaders", and a wormhole
drive tracer here.
You can go south, up, and out.
[General Communication] Melinda Michaels transmits, "I do."
i
 You are wearing a soft red heather cotton polo, a pair of blue corduroy jeans,
and a pair of gray canvas sneakers. Underneath this, you are wearing a pair of
white socks and a pair of white cotton briefs. You are also wearing a keychain,
a backpack, a metallic gold touch einrophone in a black leather phone holster, a
solid silver ring engraved with dolphins, and a gold wrist-mounted chronometer.
You are concealing a metallic silver metachannel FTL communicator, a flight
control scanner, a large expandable telescoping xenology container, a scorched
metal thigh holster, a golden Feng Wo coin purse, a camera bag, a black
engineering tool case, a black flightbag with a red shooting star on the side, a
leather briefcase, and a thick synthleather bandolier with large pockets. Your
head, face, both eyes, neck, both elbows, both forearms, both wrists, and both
hands are left uncovered.
You are carrying a package in your right hand.

7
You flip a phone-based holoemitter to IASN.
From a phone-based holoemitter: The image flashes white, and the words
"COMPETITIVE TEA-DRINKING 2310 INTERPLANETARY CHAMPIONSHIP" appear as the view
rotates rapidly around a large stadium.
From a phone-based holoemitter: A sports commentator says, "Hello! And welcome
to the Competitive Tea-Drinking Interplanetary Championship! Tonight's match,
the FINAL match, is between New Earth veteran Lynx Forrest and a newcomer from
Ars Magna, Woodward Whittaker Derringer."
From a phone-based holoemitter: The crowd filling the stadium cheers wildly as
the commentator continues. "Forrest has had a hard season, and for a time it was
far from a sure thing that he would ever make it this far!"
From a phone-based holoemitter: "But he's here tonight, and facing off against
rookie Derringer, who has come out of NOWHERE to take the sport by storm this
season!"
From a phone-based holoemitter: "Forrest is still the favorite to take the
championship title tonight, but as they say, folks, the truth is in the tea! And
it looks like we're about ready for the first cup of the night!"
From a phone-based holoemitter: The view abruptly zooms into the middle of the
field, where a small round table is set up, quaint dark wooden chairs in place,
and its surface decorated with a pair of doilies. Two impeccably-dressed men are
just now placing trays and tea services next to each of the competitors.
From a phone-based holoemitter: "The competitors' seconds are pouring the first
cup. It looks like veteran Forrest hopes to start simple but win over the judges
with superior technique, as he's chosen a classic lemon tea for his first cup."
From a phone-based holoemitter: "Newcomer Derringer has chosen a rather more
daring approach with a cup of orange tea. And he's... not taking any sugars!"
From a phone-based holoemitter: You watch Forrest accept a cube of sugar from
his second with a smile. The commentator says, "Forrest accepts one sugar... and
we're off!"
From a phone-based holoemitter: The two men eye each other intently as they
carefully swirl their steaming cups of tea.
From a phone-based holoemitter: Time passes.
From a phone-based holoemitter: Forrest takes the first sip.
From a phone-based holoemitter: "First blood!" shouts the commentator. "Forrest
has taken a sip of his piping hot beverage without betraying the slightest
reaction! Derringer will have to catch up fast if he hopes to stay competitive!"

[Starship "Firestorm"; Control Room]
The control room is the hub of every starship. Large metal conduits protect
thick bundles of wires carrying information from every part of the ship to this
one location. A large transparisteel viewport provides a view out the front of
the ship, but experienced pilots in space will have eyes only for the large
starmap dominating the right side of the room. Standing before the viewport is
the main control board, providing essential functions like the shipwide power
lever and alert status. Secondary control boards can be pulled up and folded
back to provide a working surface, or pulled down from recesses overhead as
needed. Though the room is spacious enough for a few others to sit or stand, the
entire architecture of the room is built around the small space before the
control board and the person who will stand there: the starship's pilot. The
status lights overhead are currently not receiving power. Looking through the
windows, you see that the ship is in a garage.
You see a black leather captain's chair, a decoy beacon launcher, a
bioaugmentation plant in a small pot labeled "Space Invaders", and a wormhole
drive tracer here.
You can go south, up, and out.
out

Subject: Morning Star Plants
Author: Ali Candan
Posted: 04:34 15 August 2317 GST
--
Hello everyone,
Morning Star has following plants:
* Double Hull
* Double Storage
* Double repair rate
* Double Chaingun Damage Boost
* Airlock cycle speed + max velocity
* Double Max Velocity
Give me a shout if you need any of these.

[Starship "William Dove"; Living Quarters One]
This is a small room designed to give crew members a place to sleep while on
long journeys, and it isn't large enough to do much else. A long counter is
bolted to the wall opposite the entryway, and two narrow bunks have been bolted
to the two remaining walls. A small keypad is next to the door, controlling a
simple lock. The status lights overhead are currently not receiving power.
Looking through the windows, you see that the ship is in a garage.
You see a dusky pink rattan cabinet, a small red ball containing a realistic
Bari horde noisemaker, a glossy pale purple ceramic felo chow bowl, a large oval
dark purple and light purple cloth rug, a white four poster rattan bed with a
heart-shaped headboard and filmy deep purple hangings with a soft periwinkle
cashmere blanket, a set of lavender silk sheets, a large periwinkle bed pillow,
a hand-made purple and amethyst flower quilt, and a large periwinkle bed pillow
on it, and a small oval turquoise rattan table with a glass top here.
Lily Kaise, Phoenix Dissident is dozing on a white four poster rattan bed.
You can go out.
(You are lying on a white four poster rattan bed with a heart-shaped headboard
and filmy deep purple hangings with a soft periwinkle cashmere blanket, a set of
lavender silk sheets, a large periwinkle bed pillow, a hand-made purple and
amethyst flower quilt, and a large periwinkle bed pillow on it.)
